intro: Saussurea pallidiceps, commonly known as the pale-headed saussurea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas, including parts of Nepal and India. The plant is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stem and pale yellow to white flower heads. Its leaves are typically linear and covered with dense, white or grayish hairs. Saussurea pallidiceps is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to cold, arid environments.
